member.name: T:QuickFont.Builder
member.summary: Class for building a Quick Font, given a Font and a configuration object.

member.name: M:QuickFont.Builder.GetMaxGlyphSize(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Drawing.SizeF})
member.summary: Returns the maximum width and maximum height from the list of sizes

member.summary: Returns the minimum width and minimum height from the list of sizes

member.name: M:QuickFont.Builder.IsMonospaced(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Drawing.SizeF})
member.summary: Returns true if all glyph widths are within 5% of each other

member.name: M:QuickFont.Builder.CreateInitialBitmap(QuickFont.IFont,System.Drawing.SizeF,System.Int32,QuickFont.QFontGlyph[]@,QuickFont.Configuration.TextGenerationRenderHint)
member.summary: Creates the initial font bitmap. This is simply a long thin strip of all glyphs in a row
member.param: The object to build the initial bitmap from
The maximum glyph size of the font
The initial bitmap margin (used for all four sides)
A collection of s corresponding to the initial bitmap
The font rendering hint to use

member.name: M:QuickFont.Builder.RetargetGlyphRectangleInwards(System.Drawing.Imaging.BitmapData,QuickFont.QFontGlyph,System.Boolean,System.Byte)
member.summary: Retargets a given glyph rectangle inwards, to find the minimum bounding box Assumes the current bounding box is larger than the minimum
member.param: Whether to update the y offset of the glyph or not

member.name: M:QuickFont.Builder.RetargetGlyphRectangleOutwards(System.Drawing.Imaging.BitmapData,QuickFont.QFontGlyph,System.Boolean,System.Byte)
member.summary: Retargets a given glyph rectangle outwards, to find the minimum bounding box Assumes the current bounding box is smaller than the minimum
member.param: Whether to update the y offset of the glyph or not

member.summary: Generates the final bitmap sheet for the font
member.param: A collection of s. These are written to the final bitmap
The source bitmaps for the font (initial bitmap)
A collection of s that are placed on the final bitmap sheet
The margin for the final bitmap sheet
member.returns: A collection of s. These are the final bitmap sheets

member.summary: Builds the font data

member.returns: A

member.summary: Use AntiAlias when rendering the ttf character set to create the QFont texture

member.name: F:QuickFont.Configuration.TextGenerationRenderHint.SizeDependent
member.summary: Use ClearTypeGridFit if the font is smaller than 12, otherwise use AntiAlias

member.summary: Use ClearTypeGridFit when rendering the ttf character set to create the QFont texture

member.summary: Use SystemDefault when rendering the ttf character set to create the QFont texture

member.name: M:QuickFont.Configuration.QFontBuilderConfiguration.FigureOutBestCharacterSet
member.summary: Figures the out best character set to be assigned to charSet. Depends on current active culture. To be more general we'd use the code page and distinct the most used and practically usable cultures in terms of their characters in use. Obviuously traditional chinese can not be supported well. Due to Texture size limits and even worse due to the Kerning infos (which are n² size if n is number of characters).

member.name: T:QuickFont.Configuration.CharacterKerningRule
member.summary: Kerning Rules

member.name: F:QuickFont.Configuration.CharacterKerningRule.Normal
member.summary: Ordinary kerning

member.name: F:QuickFont.Configuration.CharacterKerningRule.Zero
member.summary: All kerning pairs involving this character will kern by 0. This will override both Normal and NotMoreThanHalf for any pair.

member.name: F:QuickFont.Configuration.CharacterKerningRule.NotMoreThanHalf
member.summary: Any kerning pairs involving this character will not kern by more than half the minimum width of the two characters involved. This will override Normal for any pair.

member.name: T:QuickFont.Configuration.QFontKerningConfiguration
member.summary: Font kerning configuration Only used with GDIFont, FreeTypeFont uses it's own kerning directly from the font file

member.name: F:QuickFont.Configuration.QFontKerningConfiguration._characterKerningRules
member.summary: Kerning rules for particular characters

member.name: F:QuickFont.Configuration.QFontKerningConfiguration.AlphaEmptyPixelTolerance
member.summary: When measuring the bounds of glyphs, and performing kerning calculations, this is the minimum alpha level that is necessray for a pixel to be considered non-empty. This should be set to a value on the range [0,255]

member.name: M:QuickFont.Configuration.QFontKerningConfiguration.BatchSetCharacterKerningRule(System.String,QuickFont.Configuration.CharacterKerningRule)
member.summary: Sets all characters in the given string to the specified kerning rule.

member.name: M:QuickFont.Configuration.QFontKerningConfiguration.SetCharacterKerningRule(System.Char,QuickFont.Configuration.CharacterKerningRule)
member.summary: Sets the specified character kerning rule.

member.summary: Returns the kerning rule corresponding to the character.
member.param: The character to return the kerning rule for
member.returns: The kerning rule corresponding to the given character

member.summary: Given a pair of characters, this will return the overriding CharacterKerningRule.

member.name: F:QuickFont.Configuration.QFontShadowConfiguration.Scale
member.summary: Scale in relation to the actual font glyphs

member.name: F:QuickFont.Configuration.QFontShadowConfiguration.Type
member.summary: if type is blurred then font is blurred with gaussian blur if type is expanded letter is expanded in every direction by given amount of pixels

member.name: F:QuickFont.Configuration.QFontShadowConfiguration.BlurRadius
member.summary: The blur radius. Caution: high values will greatly impact the time it takes to build a font shadow

member.name: F:QuickFont.Configuration.QFontShadowConfiguration.BlurPasses
member.summary: Number of blur passes. Caution: high values will greatly impact the time it takes to build a font shadow

member.name: F:QuickFont.Configuration.QFontShadowConfiguration.PageMaxTextureSize
F:QuickFont.Configuration.QFontShadowConfiguration.GlyphMargin
member.summary: The margin (on all sides) around glyphs when rendered to their texture page. Note this is in addition to 3xblurRadius margin which is automatically added.

member.name: F:QuickFont.QFontRenderOptions.TransformToViewport
member.summary:
This is intended as a means of rendering text pixel-perfectly at a fixed display size (size on screen) independent of the screen resolution.
Ordinarily it is possible to render pixel-perfect text by calling QFont.Begin() / QFont.End(); however, this means working in a coordinate system corresponding to the current screen resolution. If the screen resolution changes, then the display size of the font will change accordingly which may not be desirable. Many games/applications prefer to use a fixed orthog coordinate system that is independent of screen resolution (e.g. 1000x1000) so that when the screen resolution changes, everything is still the same size on screen, it simply has higher definition - which is what this setting supports.
One option is simply not to call QFont.Begin() / QFont.End(). This works; however, it becomes impossible to assure that glyphs are rendered pixel-perfectly. Instead they will be scaled in hardware. In most cases this looks fine; however, if you are a perfectionist, you may prefer to use this option to assure pixel perfection.
Setting this option does two things:
Rendering to a specified position is transformed Measurements are transformed
So for example, suppose the screen resolution is 1024x768, but you wish to run orthog mode at 1000x1000. If you set:
myFont.Options.TransformToViewport = new Viewport(0,0,1000,1000);
Then, if you render at position 500,500:
QFont.Begin(); myFont.Options.LockToPixel = true; myFont.Print("Hello",new Vector2(500,500)); QFont.End();
This will be printed pixel-pefectly at pixel position 512, 384.
Additionally the font will be measured in terms of your 500x500 coordinate system.
The only issue is that if you change the resolution, the size of your font will change. You can get around this by loading a font size that is proportional to the screen resolution. This makes sense: if you want a font to be rendered pixel-perfectly at a higher resolution, it will need to be a larger font. At present this needs to be doen manually. E.g:
float fontScale = (float)Height / 800; compyFontSmall = new QFont("Data/comfy.ttf", 14 * fontScale);

member.name: F:QuickFont.QFontRenderOptions.LockToPixel
member.summary: Locks the position to a particular pixel, allowing the text to be rendered pixel-perfectly. You need to turn this off if you wish to move text around the screen smoothly by fractions of a pixel.

member.name: F:QuickFont.QFontRenderOptions.LockToPixelRatio
member.summary: Only applies when LockToPixel is true: This is used to transition smoothly between being locked to pixels and not

member.name: F:QuickFont.QFontRenderOptions.UseDefaultBlendFunction
F:QuickFont.QFontRenderOptions.WordWrap
member.summary: Wrap word to next line if max width hit

member.name: P:QuickFont.QFontRenderOptions.JustifyCharacterWeightForExpand
member.summary:
When a line of text is justified, space may be inserted between characters, and between words.
This parameter determines how this choice is weighted:
0.0f => word spacing only 1.0f => "fairly" distributed between both > 1.0 => in favour of character spacing
This applies to expansions only.

member.name: P:QuickFont.QFontRenderOptions.JustifyCharacterWeightForContract
member.summary:
When a line of text is justified, space may be removed between characters, and between words.
This parameter determines how this choice is weighted:
0.0f => word spacing only 1.0f => "fairly" distributed between both > 1.0 => in favour of character spacing
This applies to contractions only.

member.name: F:QuickFont.QFontRenderOptions.JustifyCapExpand
member.summary: Total justification cap as a fraction of the boundary width.

member.name: F:QuickFont.QFontRenderOptions.JustifyCapContract
member.summary: Total justification cap as a fraction of the boundary width.

member.name: F:QuickFont.QFontRenderOptions.JustifyContractionPenalty
member.summary:
By what factor justification is penalized for being negative.
(e.g. if this is set to 3, then a contraction will only happen over an expansion if it is 3 of fewer times smaller than the expansion).

member.name: F:QuickFont.QFontRenderOptions.ClippingRectangle
member.summary: The clipping rectangle to use for rendering

member.name: M:QuickFont.QFontRenderOptions.CreateClone
member.summary: Creates a clone of the render options
member.returns: The clone of the render options
